intro: Zimmermannia grandiflora, commonly known as the grandiflora zimmermannia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in well-drained sandy soils. It produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Zimmermannia grandiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
